DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Safety card active, AX5000 in the safe condition
DiagMessage.Description: The AX5000 is in the safe condition because the safety card is active.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The AX5000 is in the safe state (emergency stop circuit still active, cabling fault etc.) and should be enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Place the system in readiness for operation again.

DiagMessage.Hint: The safety card has been triggered by a certain event. Examine all safety-relevant functions of the system that could trigger such an event.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s External Periphery - Control card: Reading the ESC-eeprom failed
DiagMessage.Description: The PDI has no access to the ESC eeprom.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The EtherCAT master has not enabled the access.

DiagMessage.Description: Positive limit switch warning.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis has been moved to the positive limit switch.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the positive limit switch.

DiagMessage.Description: Negative limit switch warning.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis has been moved to the negative limit switch.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the negative limit switch.

DiagMessage.Description: The motor temperature has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The motor is about to overheat.

DiagMessage.Hint: If you ignore this warning and the motor temperature exceeds the parametrized value of IDN "S-0-0204", the servo driver will turn off with error "FD07".

DiagMessage.Description: The motor load has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The motor is just below the overload limit.

DiagMessage.Hint: If you ignore this warning and the motor load exceeds a critical value, the servo driver will turn off with error "FD17".

DiagMessage.Description: The load of the internal brake resistor has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The internal brake resistor is just below the overload limit. If the limit value is exceeded, the brake resistor will be turned off and the internal ballast power will be lost.

DiagMessage.Hint: If you ignore this warning and the utilization of the internal brake resistor continues to increase, it will be automatically limited by reducing the braking current and the voltage in the DC link can continue to increase, to the point where the servo driver turns off with error "FD4F".

DiagMessage.Description: The load of the external brake resistor has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The external brake resistor is just below the overload limit. If the limit value is exceeded, the brake resistor will be turned off and the internal ballast power will be lost.

DiagMessage.Hint: If you ignore this warning and the load of the external brake resistor continues to increase, it will be turned off and the voltage in the DC link can continue to increase, to the point where the servo driver turns off with error "FD4F".

DiagMessage.Description: The servo driver temperature has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The servo driver is about to overheat.

DiagMessage.Hint: If you ignore this warning and the servo driver temperature continues to increase, the servo driver will turn off with error "FD4D".

DiagMessage.Description: The DC link voltage has not yet reached the default value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC link has not been loaded yet.

DiagMessage.Hint: If the DC link voltage does not reach the default value, the servo driver is not ready for use or turns off during operation with the error "FD4B".

DiagMessage.Description: U_mains too high

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC link has not been loaded yet.

DiagMessage.Hint: If the DC link voltage does not reach the default value, the servo driver is not ready for use or turns off during operation with the error "FD4B".

DiagMessage.Description: U_mains too low

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC link has not been loaded yet.

DiagMessage.Hint: If the DC link voltage does not reach the default value, the servo driver is not ready for use or turns off during operation with the error "FD4B".

DiagMessage.Description: The feedback system has diagnosed a warning and set the warning bit.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal warning of the feedback system.

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The "Mini-Bootloader" or the normal Bootloader is defective

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Fatal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Ask our support.

DiagMessage.Hint: The current boot loader version can be found in the TCDriveManager under Device Info.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Serial flash error: Internal firmware file is defective
DiagMessage.Description: The internal firmware file is defective.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Fatal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Re-load the same firmware file to the AX5000, disconnect the servo drive from mains (incl. 24 V supply voltage) and try again. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Hint: The current firmware version can be found in the TCDriveManager under Device Info.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Serial flash error: Internal system data file not found
DiagMessage.Description: The internal system data file not found.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Fatal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Ask our support.

DiagMessage.Hint: If the system data file is no longer available, the following data are no longer available: Error history, EtherCAT address, Device identifier and Modulo data.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Serial flash error: Internal system data file is defective
DiagMessage.Description: The internal system data file is defective.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Fatal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Ask our support.

DiagMessage.Hint: If the system data file is defective, the following data are no longer available: Error history, EtherCAT address, Device identifier and Modulo data.

DiagMessage.Description: The general initialization of the serial flash memory has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: This error belongs to the group of the higher-level errors and always occurs together with other errors, which contain the causal problem.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the other diagnostic messages to identify the causal problem.

DiagMessage.Description: General processing of the serial flash memory data has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: This error belongs to the group of the higher-level errors and always occurs together with other errors, which contain the causal problem.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the other diagnostic messages to identify the causal problem.

DiagMessage.Description: No write access to the serial flash memory due to an address range error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Fatal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Serial flash error: Diagnostics file not found
DiagMessage.Description: The diagnostics messages file could not be found.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The serial flash don't contains the required file.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Install an actual firmware file.

DiagMessage.Description: Processing of the diagnostics messages: internal error
An EtherCAT communication error occurred during active axis control.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis state machine has reverted to the "Control and power section ready" state due to an EtherCAT communication error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: The PC is defective; there is an EMC problem; problems with the EtherCAT cabling; synchronization problems (distributed clocks)

DiagMessage.Description: An attempt was made to activate an uninitialized operating mode.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An attempt was made to select an uninitialized operating mode with the control word S-0-0134.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Initialize the desired operating mode.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Loss of the hardware enable
DiagMessage.Description: The configured hardware enable input (plug X06) has been deactivated by an external event, even though the AX5000 was under control.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Problems with the digital inputs (Connector "X06").
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the digital inputs (Connector "X06").

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Got no timer
DiagMessage.Description: A timer is not available.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: NC error handling - Timeout
DiagMessage.Description: With NC error handling activated (P-0-0350), the AX5000 was not stopped by the NC within the parametrized time period (P-0-0351).

CauseRemedy.Cause: The selected time period is too short.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Increase the time period if your application allows this.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The movement is too complex for the parametrized time period.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Program a movement that is suitable for the time period.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Maximum drive off delay time elapsed
DiagMessage.Description: The controlled stopping of the AX5000 in the event of an error or via the axis state machine is monitored with the time from the IDN "S-0-0273". The AX5000 could not be stopped within the parametrized time.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The parametrized time period is too short.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Increase the time period, if the application allows this.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unrecognized commutation error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: No motor configured
DiagMessage.Description: An attempt was made to enable the axis, even though no motor is configured.

CauseRemedy.Cause: No motor is configured.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Configure a motor.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Current control not ready to enable
DiagMessage.Description: The current controller is not ready to enable when selecting the operating mode "Position , velocity or torque control".

CauseRemedy.Cause: It is no valid commutation angle present.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Assign a commutation angle.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Velocity control not ready
DiagMessage.Description: The velocity controller is not ready to enable when selecting the operating mode "Position or velocity control".

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feedback position is invalid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the feedback system.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Position control not ready
DiagMessage.Description: The position controller is not ready to enable when selecting the operating mode "Position or velocity control".

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feedback position is invalid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the feedback system.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis state machine: Wake and Shake not idle
DiagMessage.Description: The Wake and Shake command could not be executed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis State Machine: Wake and Shake command failed
DiagMessage.Description: The execution of the Wake and Shake command has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: This error belongs to the group of the higher-level errors and always occurs together with other errors, which contain the causal problem.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the other diagnostic messages to identify the causal problem.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis State Machine: Not possible to enable
DiagMessage.Description: The axis is in calibration mode and cannot be started.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have started the internal calibration mode.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable the internal calibration mode.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis State Machine: Not possible to enable
DiagMessage.Description: The control loops of the axis are used by internal technology functions.

CauseRemedy.Cause: One or more control loops are in use by a technology or by an internal function.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Don't try to enable the axis while one of this functions is active.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis State Machine: The motor connection check failed.
DiagMessage.Description: The check of the motor connection failed.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Axis State Machine: The configured error propagation input isn't active.
%s%X%s The advanced parametrization introduced with firmware version 2.10 is required.
DiagMessage.Description: The advanced parametrization introduced with firmware version 2.10 is required.

CauseRemedy.Cause: It is NOT recommended to use a parametrization ('startup list') created for a firmware version less than v2.10!
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Use an appropriate TcDriveManager to create a new parametrization ('startup list'). Please contact the support if this isn't possible.

DiagMessage.Description: The timeout of the command "motor and feedback check" elapsed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Motor and feedback check": No hardware enable
DiagMessage.Description: The execution of the "Check motor and feedback" command has failed because the configured hardware enable is missing.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The hardware enable of the corresponding terminal point on plug "X06" is missing.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Apply the hardware enable (IDN P-0-0400).

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Motor and feedback check": Current controller is not ready to enable.
DiagMessage.Description: The command "Motor and feedback check" can't be executed because the current controller is not ready to enable.

CauseRemedy.Cause: No valid commutation offset.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: See operating instructions

DiagMessage.Description: The command "Motor and feedback check" can't be executed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.Description: The Reset command can't allocate a timer.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Reset-Command: One or more of the pending errors is not resettable
DiagMessage.Description: The reset command has failed because at least one of the present errors cannot be reset.

CauseRemedy.Cause: This diagnostic message is just a hint that one of the present errors cannot be reset.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Rectify the present error.

DiagMessage.Description: Reset command not executable, the axis hasn't been stopped yet.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis is still in motion.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Wait for the axis to come to a standstill and then repeat the command.

DiagMessage.Description: The error reaction "torque off" has been triggered and executed with the command P-0-0310.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the command P-0-0310. The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

DiagMessage.Description: The error reaction "Shorted coils brake" has been triggered and executed with the command P-0-0310.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the command P-0-0310. The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

DiagMessage.Description: The error reaction "Open loop ramp" has been triggered and executed with the command P-0-0310.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the command P-0-0310. The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

DiagMessage.Description: The error reaction "Closed loop ramp" has been triggered and executed with the command P-0-0310.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the command P-0-0310. The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

DiagMessage.Description: The error reaction "NC-Handling" has been triggered and executed with the command P-0-0310.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the command P-0-0310. The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Motor and feedback connection check": No enable permission from the safety option
DiagMessage.Description: The "Check motor and feedback connection" command has failed because there is no enable permission from the safety option.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The command is executed, but the safety card has been activated by a malfunction in the safety zone of the machine/plant.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Rectify the malfunction in the safety zone of the machine/plant and perform a reset.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The command is executed, but the safety card has been activated by a cable breakage in the 24 V supply to the card.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Rectify the cable breakage and perform a reset.

DiagMessage.Description: The timeout of the command "Wake and Shake" elapsed.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Reset": Not possible - Internal hardware error
DiagMessage.Description: The execution of the "Reset" command has failed because an internal hardware error has occurred.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal hardware error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call our support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Reset": Not possible - Drive is still enabled
DiagMessage.Description: The execution of the "Reset" command has failed because the controller enable is still active.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The controller is still demanding a controller enable, even though theC1D-bit is present.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the SoE axis state machine on the master side.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Command "Reset": Restart of the modulo calculation failed.
DiagMessage.Description: The execution of the "Reset" command has failed because the modulo calculation could not be recovered.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Parameter Set Switching: Activation of the parameter set 0 failed.
DiagMessage.Description: The default parameter set 0 could not be activated, because the dataset is not valid.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Parameter Set Switching: Switching to parameter set x failed.
DiagMessage.Description: The parameter set x could not be activated, because the dataset is not valid.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Parameter Set Switching: Feature not available
DiagMessage.Description: The functionality of the parameter set switching is not available due to the chosen interface revision.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Parameter Set Switching: Axis is in operation, switching not possible.
DiagMessage.Description: The parameter set switching is not possible. The axis is in operation.
The parameter set switching is not possible. Internal error.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Parameter Set Switching: Switching to parameter set x not possible.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Feedback error: Plug connector combination invalid
DiagMessage.Description: The process and parameter data cannot be processed with the selected plug connector combination.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The process and parameter data of a feedback systems are not processed with X11 and X21, but in a combination of X11, X21 with X41, X42 (encoder option card).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Always process the data of a feedback systems with X11, X21 or X41, X42, i.e. either with the connectors on the front or with the connectors on the encoder option card.

DiagMessage.Description: Feedback error: No OCT support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The AX5000 hardware doesn't support the OCT interface. The serial number of the AX5000 is below 105 000.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Exchange the AX5000 with one with a serial number greater than 105 000.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s No control loops allocated. Calibration mode active.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Cycle time exceeded: High priority process
DiagMessage.Description: The high-priority processes cannot be processed within the cycle time.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check whether data IDNs can be omitted during process data linking (AT / MDT).

DiagMessage.Info: AX5000_Operating-Instructions - Chapter "Commissioning-->Process data handling" and AX5000_IDN-Description: "S-0-0016" and "S-0-0024"

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Cycle time exceeded: Low priority process
DiagMessage.Description: The low-priority processes cannot be processed within the cycle time.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal software error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check whether data IDNs can be omitted during process data linking (AT / MDT).

DiagMessage.Info: AX5000_Operating-Instructions - Chapter "Commissioning-->Process data handling" and AX5000_IDN-Description: "S-0-0016" and "S-0-0024"

DiagMessage.Description: The drive detected a commutation error.
DiagMessage.Info: AX5000_Operating-Instructions - Chapter "Commissioning-->Commutation methods-->Commutation error"F2A0" and AX5000_IDN-Description: "P-0-0057"; "P-0-0150"

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Over-current error motor, measuring limit reached (X13 / X23).
DiagMessage.Description: The drive software detected an over-current on the motor phases. The limit of the current measuring range was reached.

CauseRemedy.Cause: This error depends on the total system configured:
CauseRemedy.Remedy: The solution depends on the total system configured:

CauseRemedy.Cause: Synchronous motor, current-controlled with absolute position information per pole pair.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the parametrization of the current controller.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Synchronous motor, current-controlled with incremental feedback.
Synchronous motor, current-controlled without feedback
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the parametrization of the current controller.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Asynchronous motor with feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the parametrization of the current controller and the IDNs P-0-0107 and S-0-0106.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Asynchronous motor without feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the load conditions and if necessary activate the acceleration controller (IDNs P-0-0112, P-0-0113, P-0-0114 and P-0-0451) and/or the breakdown protection controller (IDNs P-0-0115, P-0-0116, P-0-0117 and P-0-0451).

DiagMessage.Description: Processing unit periphery: Initialization failed

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The current calibration failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The current controller is in use and can't be used twice.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable the axis and start the command again.

DiagMessage.Description: The current calibration failed.

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Torque off triggered from "shorted coils brake" or "DC brake"
DiagMessage.Description: Torque off triggered from "shorted coils brake" or "DC brake"

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Velocity Control: Control deviation monitoring failed
DiagMessage.Description: The velocity deviation exceeded the limit value (see P-x-0518).

CauseRemedy.Cause: The control deviation has exceeded the value of IDN P-x-0518.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and increase the value in the IDN P-x-0518, if appropriate.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mechanical system is too sluggish.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and try make the mechanical system smoother.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error has occurred in the set value generation.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the cause (NC, internal set value generation, etc.). If no solution can be found, contact support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The current limit has been reached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check whether the motor can theoretically follow the set values.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The control parameter are unfavorable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Optimize the control parameter.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The set value dynamic characteristics are set too "hard".
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and check whether it is theoretically possible to achieve the specified dynamics.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Problems with actual value monitoring.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the position.

DiagMessage.Description: Overtravel limit exceeded.
The servo drive has detected a following error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The following error has exceeded the maximum value of IDN S-0-0159.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and increase the maximum value in the IDN S-0-0159, if appropriate.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mechanical system is too sluggish.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and try make the mechanical system smoother.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error has occurred in the set value generation.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the cause (NC, internal set value generation, etc.). If no solution can be found, contact support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The speed limit has been reached. For more informations look at the parameter S-0-0091, S-0-0113 and the motor characteristics.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check the maximum motor speed value used in the calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The current limit has been reached. For more informations look at the parameter S-0-0136, S-0-0137, S-0-0109, S-0-0111 and the motor characteristic.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check whether the motor can theoretically follow the set values.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The set value dynamic characteristics are set too "hard".
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and check whether it is theoretically possible to achieve the specified dynamics.

DiagMessage.Description: The cycle times have invalid values.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have entered invalid cycle times in the IDNs S-0-0001 and/or S-0-0002.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Enter permissible cycle times and try again.

DiagMessage.Description: Excessive position command value deviation.
Following distance calculation limit exceeded.
The position deviation is outside the range of stable operation
The initialization of the position interpolator failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An firmware error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support who is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Hint: The drive sends in case of this error an emergency which results in an event log entry. Please contact the support team with this entry.

DiagMessage.Description: An exception occurred in the position calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An firmware error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support who is responsible for you.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An firmware error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support who is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The calculation of the acceleration feedforward value failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An firmware error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support who is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: Position offset invalid: The Feedback-System has been exchanged.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The saved position offset is invalid because the serial number of the encoder has changed. E.g. a different motor has been connect.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Position offset: No position offset existing
DiagMessage.Description: Position offset: No position offset existing

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no position offset has been saved.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Position offset: Offset can't be activated. Modulo calculation is active.
DiagMessage.Description: Position offset: Offset can't be activated. Modulo calculation is active.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position offset can't be activated because the modulo calculation is enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Activate the position offset before enabling the modulo calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position offset can't be activated because the modulo calculation is enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Update the AX5000 firmware to a version 2.06 or higher.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Position offset: No position offset existing
DiagMessage.Description: Position offset: No position offset existing

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no valid position offset has been found.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Position offset: The position offset change is greater than the modulo value.
DiagMessage.Description: Position offset: The position offset change is greater than the modulo value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position offset can't be activated because the modulo calculation is enabled and the modulo value is less than the position offset change.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Use only position offset changes less than the modulo value.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: No saved data could be loaded.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: No saved data could be loaded.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the stored modulo values should be loaded.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable and re-enable the modulo calculation.

DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: Initialization data invalid.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the stored modulo values should be loaded. The loaded data values are invalid. E.g. the encoder has changed.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable and re-enable the modulo calculation.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: No saved data available.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: No saved data available.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the stored modulo values should be loaded. No data found.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable and re-enable the modulo calculation.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: Saving of the initialization data failed.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: Saving of the initialization data failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the modulo values should be stored.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable and re-enable the modulo calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the modulo values should be stored.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Contact support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: Saving of the modulo data failed.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: Saving of the modulo data failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the modulo values should be stored.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disable and re-enable the modulo calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error occurred while the modulo values should be stored.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Contact support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: The absolute range of encoder 1 is too small.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: The absolute range of encoder 1 is too small.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The modulo calculation with data storage can only be used if a multi-turn feedback is connected.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Connect and use a multi-turn feedback as feedback 1.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: The absolute range of encoder 2 is too small.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: The absolute range of encoder 2 is too small.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The modulo calculation with data storage can only be used if a multi-turn feedback is connected.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Connect and use a multi-turn feedback as feedback 2.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Modulo Calculation: Initialization failed because the feedback position is invalid.
DiagMessage.Description: Modulo Calculation: Initialization failed because the feedback position is invalid.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The initialization of the modulo calculation failed because the feedback position isn't valid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if feedback errors are present.

DiagMessage.Description: The initialization of the AX5000 has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The digital output was used more than once.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the digital output assignment.

DiagMessage.Description: The initialization of the AX5000 has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Contact support.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Initialization of the device: Failed - Firmware checksum
DiagMessage.Description: The initialization of the AX5000 has failed (Invalid firmware checksum).

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have selected a defective firmware file.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Exchange the defective firmware file to a valid one.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The cycle time of Sync0 is parametrized to an invalid value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The cycle time of Sync0 may only be configured at 62.5 µs, 125 µs or 250 µs.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the cycle time of Sync0.

DiagMessage.Hint: The configuration of the "distributed clocks" is optimally set as standard by the TwinCAT system and should be ready to run without any problems. Any changes that may be required should only be carried out by well-trained specialists.

DiagMessage.Description: Sync0 is not activated

CauseRemedy.Cause: Sync0 is not activated
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Activate Sync0.

DiagMessage.Hint: The configuration of the "distributed clocks" is optimally set as standard by the TwinCAT system and should be ready to run without any problems. Any changes that may be required should only be carried out by well-trained specialists.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Distributed clocks: Process data synchronization lost
DiagMessage.Description: The process data synchronization is not available any more.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The PC is sending invalid signals (jitter). Numerous causes are hardware problems and device drivers which mask the interrupts.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the PC.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Synchronization of the distributed clocks failed
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Restart the EtherCAT-Master.

CauseRemedy.Cause: I/O update takes place at the end of the task.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: In the System Manager parameterize the I/O update at the start of the task.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The prioritization of the individual tasks is unfavorable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the task prioritization.

DiagMessage.Hint: Further information can be found in the "Beckhoff Information System" on the homepage of www.Beckhoff.de.

DiagMessage.Description: The regulated voltage of the sense line is too high and cannot be reduced to 5.0 V.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an "external voltage" on the sense line of the feedback system "1".
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Locate this external voltage and suppress it.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The voltage regulation or the voltage measurement in the AX5000 is defective.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The regulated voltage of the sense line is too low and cannot be increased to 5.0 V.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feedback line is too long.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please shorten the feedback line.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Current consumption of the feedback system is too high.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the feedback system and replace if necessary.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The voltage regulation or the voltage measurement in the AX5000 is defective.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

DiagMessage.Description: The AX5000 did not measure any feedback voltage.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feedback connector is not correctly attached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please fasten the feedback connector securely to the AX5000.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Either the feedback or the sense line is faulty.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the line.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The sense signal parameters are invalid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the parameters.

DiagMessage.Description: The expected feedback system could not be confirmed.

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Determine the correct feedback system and enter it in the IDN P-0-0150

CauseRemedy.Cause: Rotary motor: You have selected the wrong motor and thus possibly also the wrong feedback system.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have selected an incorrect feedback system.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Compare the selected feedback system with the actually existing one.

CauseRemedy.Cause: During the motor replacement a motor with different feedback was connected.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please correct the feedback-parameterization.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feedback database was incorrectly parametrized.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Call our support dept. and replace the feedback database.

The connected feedback has a different linear resolution as parameterized in P-0-0150 / P-0-0180.
The position initialization failed because the axis is in motion and the actual feedback velocity is to high.
The parameterized feedback in P-0-0150 / P-0-0180 has a invalid single or multi-turn resolution.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Rotatory: "Bit resolution single-turn position" / "Number of clock cycles to get single-turn position" over 32 bit.
Rotatory: "Bit resolution multi-turn position" / "Number of clock cycles to get multi-turn position" over 16 bit.
Linear: "Bit resolution single-turn position" / "Number of clock cycles to get single-turn position" over 48 bit.
Linear: "Bit resolution multi-turn position" over 16 bit or "Number of clock cycles to get multi-turn position" over 0 bit.

DiagMessage.Description: P-0-0070 "motor continuous stall torque" is greater than P-0-0073 "motor peak torque"

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s ASM don't supports usage of P-0-0077

DiagMessage.Description: Motor data are missing for the calculation of the motor characteristic curve.

CauseRemedy.Cause: If at least one of the following functions - speed limitation (P-0-0451), current limitation (P-0-0451) or field weakening operation (P-0-0455) - is activated, the following parameters must be valid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the following IDNs: P-0-0055; P-0-0066; P-0-0070; P-0-0073; P-0-0077 and S-0-0196 (If no rated motor current is entered, the motor standstill current is used).

DiagMessage.Description: The mains voltage range entered is not permissible for the field weakening operation with synchronous motors.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The permissible range of the voltage value for the field weakening operation "U_mains-min and U_mains-max" of the IDN P-0-455 is calculated during initialization and compared with the parametrized value in the IDN P-0-0201.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: "U_mains-min" less than (P-0-0201 minus P-0-0203) and "U_mains-max" greater than (P-0-0201 plus P-0-0202). Check the IDNs for plausible values.

DiagMessage.Description: The parametrized current value does not correspond to the calculated value (field weakening operation).

CauseRemedy.Cause: The desired operating point is set in the TCDriveManager on the field weakening curve (slider). The current value resulting from this is automatically entered into the IDN P-0-0455; if this IDN is changed manually it can become invalid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the IDN P-0-0455 and restart the servo drive if necessary.

DiagMessage.Description: A phase of the 3-phase mains supply has failed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mains supply is faulty.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the mains supply and rectify the fault.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You are operating the AX5000 on a single-phase mains supply.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Deactivate the phase monitoring by means of IDN P-0-0204 bit 3. If you had assumed a 3-phase mains supply during the project engineering, check in the IDN P-0-0092 and P-0-0093 whether you need to enter a derating.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The 3-phase mains supply is continually afflicted by faults.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: By means of IDN P-0-0204, activate a filter that causes the phase monitoring to wait longer before triggering the error.

DiagMessage.Hint: On no account should you deactivate the phase monitoring if a phase of the 3-phase mains supply has failed, as otherwise the AX5000 will be destroyed.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Error Power Management: Wrong external brake resistor found
DiagMessage.Description: The determined values of the external brake resistor connected do not correspond to the parametrized values in the TCDriveManager.

CauseRemedy.Cause: General measurement error; measure the brake resistor and compare the ohmic value determined to the data on the type label.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: If the value corresponds, deactivate the internal test of the external brake resistor: To do this, set the IDN P-0-0204 "Disable DC link interface check" to "enable". Observe the application with regard to the proper operation of the external brake resistor.

CauseRemedy.Cause: General measurement error; measure the brake resistor and compare the ohmic value determined to the data on the type label.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: If the value does not correspond, exchange the brake resistor or enter the determined ohmic value in the TCDriveManager; afterwards, switch the 24 V supply off and on again. .

DiagMessage.Hint: If you have ruled out the above measurement errors, you can switch off the brake resistor check via the IDN P-0-0204 "Bit 1".

CauseRemedy.Cause: Brake resistor too small.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the application and calculate the required braking power.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short-circuit on X02
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the connection on X02

CauseRemedy.Cause: The card was removed inadvertently.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Insert the card again in the slot.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Safety slot: Wrong safety or dummy card inserted
DiagMessage.Description: The safety slot (X3x) of the AX5000 contains a safety or dummy card that does not match the internal control card.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The hardware used is not compatible.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Replace the safety or dummy card with a compatible version.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Safety card: safety card activated - internal reaction
DiagMessage.Description: Once the safety card has been activated there is a delay before the IGBTs are switched off. In parallel the AX5000 tries to brake the motors in a controlled manner.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The AX5000 is in the safe state (emergency stop circuit still active, cabling fault etc.).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Place the system in readiness for operation again.

DiagMessage.Hint: The safety card has been triggered by a certain event. Examine all safety-relevant functions of the system that could trigger such an event.

DiagMessage.MessageText: %s%X%s Safety slot: Wrong safety card AX5805 or AX5806 inserted
DiagMessage.Description: The safety slot (X3x) of the AX5000 contains a safety card (AX5805 or AX5806) that is incompatible with the device type. AX5y01 bis AX5140: AX5805, AX5160 bis AX5193: AX5806.
An internal error occurred while evaluating the compatibility of the safety card.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The safety card seems to be defective.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Try to use a different safety card.
